SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 2nd JUNE, 1918.
1. Yesterday the Germans attacked with tanks east of RHEIMS, The French regained practically the whole of their original line by a counter-attack, capturing 4 tanks. Their line now runs north Of SILLERY and ST. LEONARD.
The Germans also attacked on a 7 kilometre front north-west of SOISSONS but were repulsed.
A very heavy bombardment is reported between NOYON and SOISSONS this morning but no details are available.
The line as reported by G.Q.G. at 10 p.m. last night runs as follows :- MONT CHOISY - MOULIN-SOUS-TOUVENT - AUTRECHES - LE PORT, along the AISNE to COURTIL, head of VAUXBUIN ravine, CHAUDUN - VIERZY - LONG PORT - CORCY - FAVEROLLES - TROESNES - MONTE MAFROY - CHEZY-EN-ORXOIS - ST . GENGOULPH - TORCY -BOURESCHES - BOIS DE MARETTE - CHATEAU-THIERRY (held by the French), line of the MARNE to VERNEUIL - JONQUERY - BOUJACOURT STE. EUPHRAISE - COULOMMES - outskirst of RHEIMS.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
2nd June, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
For the personal information - of the Minister only. -
